title: Runtime Error for torch.set_() when using Variables storage
body_html:
The following code:

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

a = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([1]))
a.set_(a.storage(), storage_offset=0, size=a.size(), stride=a.stride())

throws

RuntimeError: set_(): argument 'sourceStorage' (position 1) must be torch.Storage, not torch.FloatStorage

whereas not using a variable

a = torch.FloatTensor([1])
a.set_(a.storage(), storage_offset=0, size=a.size(), stride=a.stride())

works just fine.

body:
The following code:

```
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

a = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([1]))
a.set_(a.storage(), storage_offset=0, size=a.size(), stride=a.stride())
```
throws
> RuntimeError: set_(): argument 'sourceStorage' (position 1) must be torch.Storage, not torch.FloatStorage

whereas not using a variable
```
a = torch.FloatTensor([1])
a.set_(a.storage(), storage_offset=0, size=a.size(), stride=a.stride())
```
works just fine.
